intro: Parosela calycosa, commonly known as the calycose parosela, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodland or scrub habitats. Its flowers are small and white or pale green, and it produces small, oval fruits. Parosela calycosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
